docs.title: Welcome to Second Brain Database
docs.text: The Second Brain Database is a comprehensive knowledge management system designed to help you store, organize, and retrieve information efficiently. It combines the power of a modern database with intuitive interfaces for managing your digital life.

docs.title: Documentation Structure
docs.text:
Our documentation is organized into three main sections to help you find exactly what you need:

  • :material-account: User Guide

    Perfect for day-to-day users. Learn how to manage your profile, use the knowledge base, shop for assets, and manage family settings.

  • :material-code-braces: Developer Guide

    For those who want to build upon the platform. Explore the architecture, API reference, and contribution guidelines.

  • :material-server-network: Advanced Guide

    For system administrators and power users. Deep dive into deployment, configuration, and troubleshooting.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Knowledge Management: Store and organize notes, documents, and links.
  • Family Hub: Manage family relationships and shared resources.
  • Digital Shop: Purchase and manage digital assets.
  • University Clubs: Manage club events and memberships.
  • Secure: Built with robust authentication and authorization.

docs.title: Advanced Guide
docs.text: This section is for system administrators and advanced users who need to deploy, configure, and maintain the Second Brain Database instance.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text:
• Deployment: Docker, Kubernetes, and Bare Metal deployment guides.
  • Configuration: Detailed configuration options.
  • Troubleshooting: Common issues and solutions.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Configuration is managed via environment variables or a .sbd file.

docs.title: Core Settings
docs.text: Variable Description Default MONGODB_URL MongoDB connection string Required SECRET_KEY JWT signing key Required REDIS_URL Redis connection string redis://localhost:6379/0

docs.title: Feature Flags
docs.text:
• MCP_ENABLED: Enable Model Context Protocol server.
  • CLUSTER_ENABLED: Enable distributed cluster mode.

docs.title: Docker Compose (Recommended)
docs.text:
The easiest way to deploy is using Docker Compose.

docker-compose up -d

docs.title: Kubernetes
docs.text:
For production clusters, use the provided Kubernetes manifests.

kubectl apply -f k8s/

docs.title: Bare Metal
docs.text: See the scripts/deploy_bare_metal.sh script for details on setting up a bare metal environment.

docs.title: Database Connection Failed
docs.text:
• Check if MongoDB is running.
  • Verify MONGODB_URL is correct.

docs.title: Redis Connection Failed
docs.text:
• Check if Redis is running.
  • Verify REDIS_URL.

docs.title: Authentication Errors
docs.text:
• Ensure SECRET_KEY is consistent across restarts if not persisted.
  • Check system time synchronization for TOTP.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: For maximum performance or specific hardware requirements, you can deploy directly on a Linux server.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (recommended)
  • Python 3.10+
  • MongoDB 6.0+
  • Redis 7.0+

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone Repository 

    git clone https://github.com/rohanbatrain/second_brain_database.git
cd second_brain_database

  2. Install Dependencies We use uv for fast package management. 

    curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh
uv sync --extra prod

  3. Systemd Service Create /etc/systemd/system/sbd.service: 

    [Unit]
Description=Second Brain Database API
After=network.target mongodb.service redis.service

[Service]
User=sbd
Group=sbd
WorkingDirectory=/opt/second_brain_database
EnvironmentFile=/opt/second_brain_database/.env
ExecStart=/root/.cargo/bin/uv run uvicorn src.second_brain_database.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --workers 4
Restart=always

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

  4. Start Service 

    sudo systemctl enable --now sbd

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: We provide a production-ready docker-compose.yml that orchestrates the entire stack.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Docker Engine 20.10+
  • Docker Compose v2.0+

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. Copy .env.example to .env.
  2. Set secure passwords for MONGODB_PASSWORD and REDIS_PASSWORD.
  3. Generate a strong SECRET_KEY.

docs.title: Running the Stack
docs.text:
# Start all services in detached mode
docker-compose up -d

# View logs
docker-compose logs -f

docs.title: Production Considerations
docs.text:
• Volume Management: Ensure mongo_data and redis_data volumes are backed up.
  • Resource Limits: Adjust CPU and memory limits in docker-compose.yml based on your host.
  • Networking: The API is exposed on port 8000 by default. Use a reverse proxy (Nginx/Traefik) for SSL termination.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Our Kubernetes manifests provide a scalable, high-availability deployment.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• A Kubernetes cluster (v1.24+)
  • kubectl configured
  • A storage class for persistent volumes

docs.title: Deployment Steps
docs.text:
1. Create Namespace 

    kubectl create namespace sbd

  2. Apply Secrets Edit k8s/secrets.yaml with your credentials and apply: 

    kubectl apply -f k8s/secrets.yaml -n sbd

  3. Deploy Database & Cache 

    kubectl apply -f k8s/mongodb.yaml -n sbd
kubectl apply -f k8s/redis.yaml -n sbd

  4. Deploy Application 

    kubectl apply -f k8s/deployment.yaml -n sbd
kubectl apply -f k8s/service.yaml -n sbd

  5. Configure Ingress Update k8s/ingress.yaml with your domain and apply: 

    kubectl apply -f k8s/ingress.yaml -n sbd

docs.title: Scaling
docs.text:
To scale the API replicas: 

kubectl scale deployment/sbd-api --replicas=3 -n sbd

docs.title: User Guide
docs.text: Welcome to the User Guide! This section is designed to help you get the most out of the Second Brain Database.

docs.title: What you can do
docs.text:
• Manage Your Profile: Customize your avatar, banner, and theme.
  • Organize Knowledge: Create and manage your personal knowledge base.
  • Family Hub: Connect with family members and share resources.
  • Shop: Browse and purchase digital assets.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: If you are new here, we recommend starting with the Getting Started guide.

docs.title: Knowledge Base
docs.text: Store your thoughts, documents, and links in a structured way. Use tags and categories to organize your content.

docs.title: Family Hub
docs.text: Manage your family's digital life. Share calendars, lists, and important documents securely.

docs.title: Digital Shop
docs.text: Browse the shop for themes, plugins, and other digital assets to enhance your Second Brain experience.

docs.title: University Clubs
docs.text: If enabled, join and manage university clubs, view events, and connect with other members.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• A modern web browser
  • An invitation code (if required by your administrator)

docs.title: Registration
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the login page.
  2. Click "Register".
  3. Fill in your details.
  4. Verify your email (if enabled).

docs.title: First Steps
docs.text: Once logged in, you can: - Complete your profile: Add an avatar and banner. - Explore the Knowledge Base: Create your first note. - Join a Family: Ask your family admin for an invite link.
